meanings.sent1: Tom tried to hornswoggle his friends by pretending to be a magician.
meanings.sent2: She didn't want to be hornswoggled into buying something she didn't need.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat managed to hornswoggle the dog into chasing its tail.
meanings.sent4: The con artist was able to hornswoggle unsuspecting tourists out of their money.
meanings.sent5: The clever fox used its cunning to hornswoggle the farmer's chickens.

meanings.sent1: The elaborate hornswoggle was uncovered by the vigilant detective.
meanings.sent2: The scam artist's hornswoggle left many people in financial ruin.
meanings.sent3: The old pirate's favorite tale was about a legendary hornswoggle he pulled off.
meanings.sent4: The politician's promises turned out to be nothing but a grand hornswoggle.
meanings.sent5: The magician's performance was revealed to be a clever hornswoggle.
